1. Minutes of Jan 29, 2024 5:30 PM Accepted
Public Comment
I. City Manager's Agenda
1. CMA 2024 #11 : Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of $229,126.03, received from the Executive Office of Public Safety and Security, State 911 Department, to the Grant Fund Emergency Communications Department Salary and Wages account ($159,393.03), and the Grant Fund Emergency Communications Department Travel and Training account ($69,733). This formula-based reimbursement grant will support training of Emergency Communications Center personnel, classroom fees, and training materials. ORDER ADOPTED [Unanimous]
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
2. CMA 2024 #12 : A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the re-appointment of Elaine M. DeRosa as a member of the person as a member of the Cambridge Housing Authority Board of Commissioners. REFERRED [Unanimous]

TO THE HOUSING COMMITTEE

City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
3. CMA 2024 #13 : A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to Mayor Simmons' recommended appointments to the Family Policy Council: City Councillor Sumbul Siddiqui, City Councillor Ayesha Wilson, and School Committee Member Caroline Hunter. PLACED ON FILE [Unanimous]
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
4. CMA 2024 #14 : Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of $4,620.00 to the Grant Fund Human Service Programs Salary and Wages account. In addition to the ESOL and ABE teaching, this federal grant provides funding for advising (education and career advising), civics education, digital literacy instruction and assessment, for Math, ELA (English Language Arts) and ESOL curriculum development and coordination, technology and digital literacy coordination, volunteer coordination, outreach activities and professional development for teachers and staff. ORDER ADOPTED [Unanimous]
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
5. CMA 2024 #15 : Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of $10,000, to the Grant Fund Human Service Programs Other Ordinary Maintenance account ($9,500.00), and to the Grant Fund Human Service Programs Travel and Training account ($500.00). These donations will be used to support services for Cambridge Seniors, including gift cards for strategic planning focus groups, transportation for special senior center events and trips, and support of social groups. ORDER ADOPTED [Unanimous]
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
6. CMA 2024 #16 : Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of $264,810 , funded by the Massachusetts Executive Office of Elder Affairs to the Grant Fund Department of Human Service Programs Salary and Wages account ($162,692.00), to the Grant Fund Department of Human Service Programs Other Ordinary Maintenance account ($88,118.00), and to the Grant Fund Department of Human Service Programs Travel and Training account ($14,000.00). ORDER ADOPTED [Unanimous]
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
7. CMA 2024 #17 : Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of $5,000.00 to the Grant Fund Human Service Programs Salary and Wages account ($5,000.00). The funds will support the career advising of the CNA training program with some instruction to support CNA graduates who need review prior to taking the state exam. ORDER ADOPTED [Unanimous]
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
8. CMA 2024 #18 : Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of $150,469.00, received from the Massachusetts Department of Housing and Community Development to the Grant Fund Human Service Programs Other Ordinary Maintenance account ($150,469.00). ORDER ADOPTED [Unanimous]
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
9. CMA 2024 #19 : Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of $104,830.24 to the Grant Fund Human Service Programs Salary and Wages account ($94,347.24) and to the Grant Fund Human Service Programs Other Ordinary Maintenance account ($10,483.00). These funds will be used to reimburse the City for salary and program costs associated with enrolling income-eligible youth in the Mayors Summer Youth Employment Program. ORDER ADOPTED [Unanimous]
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
10. CMA 2024 #20 : A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report Item Number 24-01, regarding Lesley Universitys ARPA-funded training program with the City of Somerville. PLACED ON FILE [Unanimous]
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
11. CMA 2024 #21 : A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the Cycling Safety Ordinance (CSO) Economic Impact Report. PLACED ON FILE
City Manager's Agenda Item Printout
a. CSO Econ Impact Report Cover Memo_021224

1. POR 2024 #14 : Declare March 2, 2024, as Cambridge Youth Hockey Day in Cambridge. Order Adopted
Policy Order Printout
2. POR 2024 #15 : That the City Manager is requested to direct the Community Development Department to commence the process of drafting updated district maps and development processes, along with the zoning language and relevant ordinances to allow for and encourage the continued growth, redevelopment, and evolution of Central Square. Order Adopted
Policy Order Printout
3. POR 2024 #16 : That the City Manager is requested to facilitate the participation in a public hearing(s) and or working session(s) to address Racial and Gender Disparities in City contracting and procurement. Order Adopted and Referred

TO THE ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND UNIVERSITY RELATIONS COMMITTEE

Policy Order Printout
4. POR 2024 #17 : That the City Solicitor in collaboration with the Commissioner of Traffic, Parking and Transportation, Community Development Department and the Police Department research rules and regulations governing the use of Electric Micromobility Devices and what, if any, authority Cambridge has to introduce its own regulations of these Devices including speed and location of use, and report back to the City Council in a timely manner. Order Adopted
Policy Order Printout
5. POR 2024 #18 : That the City Manager direct the Solicitors Office, Election Commission and any other department deemed necessary, to review the Final Report of the Charter Review Committee and its proposals and provide written feedback on the legality, and practicality of the proposals in advance of future discussion. Order Adopted as Amended
Policy Order Printout
6. POR 2024 #19 : The Final Report of the Charter Review Committee be referred to the Government Operations, Rules and Claims Committee. CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY MAYOR SIMMONS IN COUNCIL FEBRUARY 12, 2024 Charter Right

EXERCISED BY MAYOR SIMMONS

Policy Order Printout
